dn28:3.1.pli: Aparaṁ pana, bhante, etadānuttariyaṁ, yathā bhagavā dhammaṁ deseti kusalesu dhammesu.
dn28:3.1.en: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches skillful qualities is unsurpassable.

dn28:3.5.en: This is unsurpassable when it comes to skillful qualities.

dn28:4.1.pli: Aparaṁ pana, bhante, etadānuttariyaṁ, yathā bhagavā dhammaṁ deseti āyatanapaṇṇattīsu.
dn28:4.1.en: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches the description of the sense fields is unsurpassable.

dn28:4.4.en: This is unsurpassable when it comes to describing the sense fields.

dn28:5.1.pli: Aparaṁ pana, bhante, etadānuttariyaṁ, yathā bhagavā dhammaṁ deseti gabbhāvakkantīsu.
dn28:5.1.en: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches the conception of the embryo is unsurpassable.

dn28:5.7.en: This is unsurpassable when it comes to the conception of the embryo.

dn28:6.1.pli: Aparaṁ pana, bhante, etadānuttariyaṁ, yathā bhagavā dhammaṁ deseti ādesanavidhāsu.
dn28:6.1.en: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches the different ways of revealing is unsurpassable.

dn28:6.19.en: This is unsurpassable when it comes to the ways of revealing.

dn28:7.1.pli: Aparaṁ pana, bhante, etadānuttariyaṁ, yathā bhagavā dhammaṁ deseti dassanasamāpattīsu.
dn28:7.1.en: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches the attainments of vision is unsurpassable.

dn28:7.20.en: This is unsurpassable when it comes to attainments of vision.

dn28:8.1.pli: Aparaṁ pana, bhante, etadānuttariyaṁ, yathā bhagavā dhammaṁ deseti puggalapaṇṇattīsu.
dn28:8.1.en: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches the description of individuals is unsurpassable.

dn28:8.4.en: This is unsurpassable when it comes to the description of individuals.

dn28:9.1.pli: Aparaṁ pana, bhante, etadānuttariyaṁ, yathā bhagavā dhammaṁ deseti padhānesu.
dn28:9.1.en: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches the kinds of striving is unsurpassable.

dn28:9.3.en: This is unsurpassable when it comes to the kinds of striving.

dn28:10.1.pli: Aparaṁ pana, bhante, etadānuttariyaṁ, yathā bhagavā dhammaṁ deseti paṭipadāsu.
dn28:10.1.en: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches the ways of practice is unsurpassable.

dn28:10.10.en: This is unsurpassable when it comes to the ways of practice.

dn28:11.1.pli: Aparaṁ pana, bhante, etadānuttariyaṁ, yathā bhagavā dhammaṁ deseti bhassasamācāre.
dn28:11.1.en: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches behavior in speech is unsurpassable.

dn28:11.4.en: This is unsurpassable when it comes to behavior in speech.

dn28:12.1.pli: Aparaṁ pana, bhante, etadānuttariyaṁ, yathā bhagavā dhammaṁ deseti purisasīlasamācāre.
dn28:12.1.en: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches a person’s ethical behavior is unsurpassable.

dn28:12.3.en: This is unsurpassable when it comes to a person’s ethical behavior.

dn28:13.1.pli: Aparaṁ pana, bhante, etadānuttariyaṁ, yathā bhagavā dhammaṁ deseti anusāsanavidhāsu.
dn28:13.1.en: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches the different degrees of responsiveness to instruction is unsurpassable.

dn28:13.11.en: This is unsurpassable when it comes to the different degrees of responsiveness to instruction.

dn28:14.1.pli: Aparaṁ pana, bhante, etadānuttariyaṁ, yathā bhagavā dhammaṁ deseti parapuggalavimuttiñāṇe.
dn28:14.1.en: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches the knowledge and freedom of other individuals is unsurpassable.

dn28:14.10.en: This is unsurpassable when it comes to the knowledge and freedom of other individuals.

dn28:15.1.pli: Aparaṁ pana, bhante, etadānuttariyaṁ, yathā bhagavā dhammaṁ deseti sassatavādesu.
dn28:15.1.en: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches eternalist doctrines is unsurpassable.

dn28:15.26.en: This is unsurpassable when it comes to eternalist doctrines.

dn28:16.1.pli: Aparaṁ pana, bhante, etadānuttariyaṁ, yathā bhagavā dhammaṁ deseti pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇe.
dn28:16.1.en: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches the knowledge of recollecting past lives is unsurpassable.

dn28:16.8.en: This is unsurpassable when it comes to the knowledge of recollecting past lives.

dn28:17.1.pli: Aparaṁ pana, bhante, etadānuttariyaṁ, yathā bhagavā dhammaṁ deseti sattānaṁ cutūpapātañāṇe.
dn28:17.1.en: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches the knowledge of the death and rebirth of sentient beings is unsurpassable.

dn28:17.4.en: This is unsurpassable when it comes to the knowledge of death and rebirth.

dn28:18.1.pli: Aparaṁ pana, bhante, etadānuttariyaṁ, yathā bhagavā dhammaṁ deseti iddhividhāsu.
dn28:18.1.en: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches psychic power is unsurpassable.

dn28:18.16.en: This is unsurpassable when it comes to psychic powers.

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 28
Inspiring Confidence
1. Sāriputta’s Lion’s Roar

an6.30:1.3.pli: Dassanānuttariyaṁ, savanānuttariyaṁ, lābhānuttariyaṁ, sikkhānuttariyaṁ, pāricariyānuttariyaṁ, anussatānuttariyanti.
an6.30:1.3.en: The unsurpassable seeing, listening, acquisition, training, service, and recollection.

an6.30:2.1.en: And what is the unsurpassable seeing?

an6.30:2.5.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, tathāgataṁ vā tathāgatasāvakaṁ vā dassanāya gacchati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno, etadānuttariyaṁ, bhikkhave, dassanānaṁ sattānaṁ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṁ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yadidaṁ tathāgataṁ vā tathāgatasāvakaṁ vā dassanāya gacchati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno.
an6.30:2.5.en: The unsurpassable seeing is when someone with settled faith and love, sure and devoted, goes to see a Realized One or their disciple. This is in order to purify sentient beings, to get past sorrow and crying, to make an end of pain and sadness, to end the cycle of suffering, and to realize extinguishment.

an6.30:2.6.en: This is called the unsurpassable seeing.

an6.30:3.1.en: But what of the unsurpassable hearing?

an6.30:3.5.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, tathāgatassa vā tathāgatasāvakassa vā dhammassavanāya gacchati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno, etadānuttariyaṁ, bhikkhave, savanānaṁ sattānaṁ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṁ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yadidaṁ tathāgatassa vā tathāgatasāvakassa vā dhammassavanāya gacchati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno.
an6.30:3.5.en: The unsurpassable hearing is when someone with settled faith and love, sure and devoted, goes to hear the teaching of a Realized One or one of his disciples. …

an6.30:3.6.en: This is called the unsurpassable hearing.

an6.30:3.7.en: Such is the unsurpassable seeing and hearing.

an6.30:4.1.en: But what of the unsurpassable acquisition?

an6.30:4.5.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, tathāgate vā tathāgatasāvake vā saddhaṁ paṭilabhati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno, etadānuttariyaṁ, bhikkhave, lābhānaṁ sattānaṁ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṁ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yadidaṁ tathāgate vā tathāgatasāvake vā saddhaṁ paṭilabhati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno.
an6.30:4.5.en: The unsurpassable acquisition is when someone with settled faith and love, sure and devoted, acquires faith in a Realized One or their disciple. …

an6.30:4.6.en: This is called the unsurpassable acquisition.

an6.30:4.7.en: Such is the unsurpassable seeing, hearing, and acquisition.

an6.30:5.1.en: But what of the unsurpassable training?

an6.30:5.5.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye adhisīlampi sikkhati, adhicittampi sikkhati, adhipaññampi sikkhati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno, etadānuttariyaṁ, bhikkhave, sikkhānaṁ sattānaṁ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṁ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yadidaṁ tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye adhisīlampi sikkhati, adhicittampi sikkhati, adhipaññampi sikkhati, niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno.
an6.30:5.5.en: The unsurpassable training is when someone with settled faith and love, sure and devoted, trains in the higher ethics, the higher mind, and the higher wisdom in the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One. …

an6.30:5.6.en: This is called the unsurpassable training.

an6.30:5.7.en: Such is the unsurpassable seeing, hearing, acquisition, and training.

an6.30:6.1.en: But what of the unsurpassable service?

an6.30:6.5.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, tathāgataṁ vā tathāgatasāvakaṁ vā paricarati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno, etadānuttariyaṁ, bhikkhave, pāricariyānaṁ sattānaṁ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṁ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yadidaṁ tathāgataṁ vā tathāgatasāvakaṁ vā paricarati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno.
an6.30:6.5.en: The unsurpassable service is when someone with settled faith and love, sure and devoted, serves a Realized One or their disciple. …

an6.30:6.6.en: This is called the unsurpassable service.

an6.30:6.7.pli: Iti dassanānuttariyaṁ, savanānuttariyaṁ, lābhānuttariyaṁ, sikkhānuttariyaṁ, pāricariyānuttariyaṁ.
an6.30:6.7.en: Such is the unsurpassable seeing, listening, acquisition, training, and service.

an6.30:7.1.en: But what of the unsurpassable recollection?

an6.30:7.5.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, tathāgataṁ vā tathāgatasāvakaṁ vā anussarati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno, etadānuttariyaṁ, bhikkhave, anussatīnaṁ sattānaṁ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṁ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yadidaṁ tathāgataṁ vā tathāgatasāvakaṁ vā anussarati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno.
an6.30:7.5.en: The unsurpassable recollection is when someone with settled faith and love, sure and devoted, recollects a Realized One or their disciple. …

an6.30:7.6.en: This is called the unsurpassable recollection.

an6.30:8.1.en: These are the six unsurpassable things.

an6.8:1.3.pli: Dassanānuttariyaṁ, savanānuttariyaṁ, lābhānuttariyaṁ, sikkhānuttariyaṁ, pāricariyānuttariyaṁ, anussatānuttariyaṁ.
an6.8:1.3.en: The unsurpassable seeing, listening, acquisition, training, service, and recollection.

an6.8:1.4.en: These are the six unsurpassable things.”

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 6
1. Worthy of Offerings
8. Unsurpassable

dn33:2.2.113.pli: dassanānuttariyaṁ, savanānuttariyaṁ, lābhānuttariyaṁ, sikkhānuttariyaṁ, pāricariyānuttariyaṁ, anussatānuttariyaṁ.
dn33:2.2.113.en: the unsurpassable seeing, listening, acquisition, training, service, and recollection.

an1.175-186:1.1.pli: “Ekapuggalassa, bhikkhave, pātubhāvā mahato cakkhussa pātubhāvo hoti, mahato ālokassa pātubhāvo hoti, mahato obhāsassa pātubhāvo hoti, channaṁ anuttariyānaṁ pātubhāvo hoti, catunnaṁ paṭisambhidānaṁ sacchikiriyā hoti, anekadhātupaṭivedho hoti, nānādhātupaṭivedho hoti, vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyā hoti, sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyā hoti, sakadāgāmiphalasacchikiriyā hoti, anāgāmiphalasacchikiriyā hoti, arahattaphalasacchikiriyā hoti.
an1.175-186:1.1.en: “With the appearance of one person, mendicants, there is the appearance of a great eye, a great light, a great radiance, and the six unsurpassable things; the realization of the four kinds of textual analysis; the penetration of many and diverse elements; the realization of the fruit of knowledge and freedom; the realization of the fruits of stream-entry, once-return, non-return, and perfection.

an1.175-186:1.4.pli: Imassa kho, bhikkhave, ekapuggalassa pātubhāvā mahato cakkhussa pātubhāvo hoti, mahato ālokassa pātubhāvo hoti, mahato obhāsassa pātubhāvo hoti, channaṁ anuttariyānaṁ pātubhāvo hoti, catunnaṁ paṭisambhidānaṁ sacchikiriyā hoti, anekadhātupaṭivedho hoti, nānādhātupaṭivedho hoti, vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyā hoti, sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyā hoti, sakadāgāmiphalasacchikiriyā hoti, anāgāmiphalasacchikiriyā hoti, arahattaphalasacchikiriyā hotī”ti.
an1.175-186:1.4.en: This is the one person whose appearance brings the appearance of a great eye, a great light, a great radiance, and the six unsurpassable things; the realization of the four kinds of textual analysis; the penetration of many and diverse elements; the realization of the fruit of knowledge and release; the realization of the fruits of stream-entry, once-return, non-return, and perfection.”

mn35:26.1.pli: Evaṁ vimuttacitto kho, aggivessana, bhikkhu tīhi anuttariyehi samannāgato hoti—
mn35:26.1.en: A mendicant whose mind is freed like this has three unsurpassable qualities:

dn34:1.7.81.en: the unsurpassable seeing, listening, acquisition, training, service, and recollection.

an6.140:1.3.en: The unsurpassable seeing, listening, acquisition, training, service, and recollection.

an10.22:2.4.en: But this is the unsurpassable knowledge, that is: truly knowing each and every case.
